history.text: Hi how are you.  Do you have any young kids?
Yes I do. She loves this movie!
I liked this movie a lot. I thought it was very entertaining but I also identified with the main character, Judy Hopps.
Yes, I think what is great about Zootopia was that it was a "smart" animation populated by anthopomorphic animals
they did a great job making them lifelike and even having Judy Hopps character bunnyburrow as valedictorian
I think it was smart and funny for adults while at the same time keeping kids interested and entertained
I agree.
they say a big part of the object was to overcome species stereotypes and get the young people to think the same about people
Yes, the characters were constantly trying to see past their differences.
It made you think about the most basic stereotypes.
I agree.  Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 98% positive review and an 8/10 by viewers
What did you think of the Judy  Hopps Character bunnyburrow becoming a police officer which she always wanted to do

She went from rural Bunnyburrow to the big city, Zootopia, which she always dreamed about. But then she realized that it wasn't as perfect as she thought it would be, and then had to figure out how to get past her idealized version of it.
I like Jason Bateman as an actor so the fact he did the voice over for Nick Wilde the red fox as a con artist was also fun
Jason Bateman is great, and Ginnifer Goodwin was fabulous as Judy. I thought Idris Elba as Chief Bogo was a great choice.
I liked when Judy and Nick had that moment where he admitted that he was bullied as a child.
Did you think as an animation that they hit some issues they should not have like Bunnyburrow blackmailing Nick to help her out by recording his tax evasion confession
I like that when Judy solved the case she and nick had become friends and he was asked to join the police force as her partner
I actually thought that was clever, because he was always trying to outwit everyone else, and she was really the first one who used his tricks against him.
It was a twist that she quit her job when at the press conference she suggested a biological cause for the recent behavior of the "animals"
There were a few twists, like where you find out all the animals went savage and Lionheart the mayor knew about it.
I do not think she meant to cause the friction between the predators and prey in the city. She quit from guilt
She did feel guilty about what she said.
my document just went blank but the finish conversation has not highlighted
And another twist was that the night howlers, which Judy thought were wolves, were flowers that were toxic and that is what caused the animals to go savage.
I agree.  Overall it seems like you liked the movie with your child
It was a good movie. I watched it many times with her and it didn't get old or boring. It's a fun movie.
do you agree with the 8/10 rating
I do.
It said we would get 4 documents...I only got 2 pages here?
I got the other two so that is 4 total . I think we have a problem. I do not like when that happens

uid1response.feedback: I had a good back and forth

uid2response.feedback: we had a good chat about the movie.
